title: How to identify when a function is being called using IDA?
content:
I'm debugging a .exe file on Windows with IDA's debugger.

How can I identify when the code calls the random() function?

answers_data.content: While the debugger is loaded and the executable is running, double-click on the random() function entry in the imports tab/view to see it in the disassembler view. Then place a breakpoint on it using Debugger -> Breakpoints -> Add breakpoint.

comments.text: (F2 is the keyboard shortcut for placing breakpoints)
